episodeTitle: An Ancient Island! The Shadow Hiding in Little Garden!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at the mysterious prehistoric island of Little Garden. While Mr. 3 and Miss Goldenweek receive new orders on Kyuka Island, the crew encounters massive dinosaurs and other ancient creatures. Zoro and Sanji begin a heated hunting competition, and the episode ends with the ominous appearance of a giant's shadow.

events.title: Mr. 3 and Miss Goldenweek Debut
events.description: On Kyuka Island, Baroque Works Officer Agents Mr. 3 and Miss Goldenweek are shown relaxing on vacation. Mr. 3 is preparing Earl Grey tea while Miss Goldenweek casually mentions new orders from the organization that she received days ago but neglected to share immediately.
events.significance: Introduces two new Baroque Works agents who will become central antagonists in the Little Garden arc. Establishes Mr. 3's intellectual personality and Miss Goldenweek's laid-back nature.

quotes.speaker: Mr. 3
quotes.context: Mr. 3 showing his refined tastes while on vacation

events.title: Kyuka Island Debut
events.description: The tropical vacation island of Kyuka Island is shown, featuring hotels, palm trees, and resort facilities. This is where Baroque Works agents take their leisure time between missions.
events.significance: Establishes that even Baroque Works agents get vacation time, adding depth to the organization's structure.

events.title: Mr. 3's Doru Doru no Mi Introduction
events.description: Mr. 3 demonstrates his Wax-Wax Fruit powers by creating a white wax house structure. His ability to create and manipulate wax for various purposes is revealed, showcasing both artistic and practical applications.
events.significance: First display of the Doru Doru no Mi Devil Fruit abilities, which will be crucial to upcoming battles and strategies in Little Garden.

events.title: Arrival at Little Garden
events.description: The Going Merry approaches and arrives at Little Garden, a mysterious prehistoric island. The crew immediately notices unusual roaring sounds and massive jungle vegetation that dwarfs normal islands.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Little Garden arc and introduces one of the Grand Line's most unique islands, setting the stage for encounters with giants and Baroque Works agents.

quotes.text: What kind of island is this?
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Expressing concern upon seeing the unusual island

events.title: Little Garden Prehistoric Island Debut
events.description: Little Garden is revealed to be a prehistoric island frozen in time, populated by dinosaurs and massive plant life. The island's unique climate has kept it in a prehistoric state while the rest of the world evolved.
events.significance: Establishes Little Garden as one of the Grand Line's most dangerous and unique islands, demonstrating the variety and strangeness of the Grand Line's environments.

quotes.text: It's like we've gone back in time!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

events.title: Nami Remembers Little Garden's Legend
events.description: Nami recalls reading about Little Garden in a book. According to explorer Louis Arnote's account, the island was given its name due to its unique prehistoric nature, though he warned that those who visited never returned.
events.significance: Provides backstory and foreshadowing about the island's dangers while establishing it has a reputation among sailors.

quotes.text: I remember now! This island is called Little Garden, and according to the book, no one who has gone there has ever come back!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Warning the crew about the island's dangerous reputation

events.title: Crew Splits to Explore
events.description: Despite the warnings, Luffy, Vivi, Zoro, and Sanji decide to explore the island for food and adventure. Nami and Usopp, being more cautious, choose to stay aboard the Going Merry to guard the ship.
events.significance: Establishes the exploration dynamic and separates the crew, setting up individual encounters with the island's dangers.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Refusing to explore the dangerous island

quotes.text: Me too. Someone has to guard the ship anyway.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Supporting Usopp's decision while providing practical justification

events.title: Zoro and Sanji's Hunting Competition Begins
events.description: Upon entering the jungle, Zoro and Sanji immediately get into an argument about who can hunt the biggest dinosaur. They turn their exploration into a competition, with each determined to bring back more meat than the other.
events.significance: This marks the formal beginning of Zoro and Sanji's legendary rivalry that will continue throughout the series, establishing their competitive dynamic.

quotes.text: I bet I can hunt bigger prey than you, moss-head!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Challenging Zoro to a hunting competition

events.title: Sanji vs Tyrannosaurus Rex
events.description: Sanji encounters a massive Tyrannosaurus Rex in the jungle. The dinosaur attempts to eat him, leading to a brief but intense confrontation where Sanji uses his powerful kicks to defend himself.
events.significance: Demonstrates the real danger of Little Garden's prehistoric inhabitants and showcases Sanji's combat abilities against large creatures.

quotes.text: I'm not going to be dinosaur food!
quotes.speaker: Sanji

events.title: Zoro vs Triceratops
events.description: Zoro encounters a Triceratops and immediately wonders if it would be good to eat. He engages the dinosaur in combat, viewing it as both a challenge and a potential meal for the crew.
events.significance: Shows Zoro's combat prowess and his practical approach to hunting, while demonstrating the variety of prehistoric creatures on Little Garden.

quotes.text: I wonder if this thing is edible.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Sizing up the Triceratops as potential food

events.title: Luffy and Vivi Encounter Brachiosaurus
events.description: Luffy and Vivi come across a massive Brachiosaurus (long-necked dinosaur) peacefully eating vegetation. Luffy is fascinated by the creature's size while Vivi is amazed and frightened.
events.significance: Provides variety in dinosaur encounters and shows different character reactions to Little Garden's prehistoric wildlife.

quotes.text: Wow! Look at the size of that thing!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Excited reaction to seeing the Brachiosaurus

events.title: Louis Arnote's Little Garden Account
events.description: Through Nami's recollection, the explorer Louis Arnote's historical account of Little Garden is revealed. He documented the island's prehistoric nature and gave it the name 'Little Garden', though his reports warned of its extreme danger.
events.significance: Provides world-building lore about Grand Line exploration and establishes that Little Garden has been documented before, adding historical context.

events.title: Samurai Batts Transponder Snail Debut
events.description: Mr. 3's personal transponder snail, Samurai Batts, is shown. This unique snail wears samurai-style armor and serves as Mr. 3's communication device for receiving orders from Baroque Works.
events.significance: Introduces a unique character design element and shows the variety of transponder snails in the One Piece world.

events.title: Giant's Shadow Appears
events.description: As the episode concludes, a massive shadow looms over the jungle. The silhouette of an enormous humanoid figure appears, towering over the trees. This is Brogy, one of the two giant warriors of Little Garden, though he is not yet fully revealed.
events.significance: Creates suspense and foreshadows the introduction of the giants, setting up major encounters for the next episode. The shadow's immense size hints at threats beyond even the dinosaurs.

events.title: Miss Goldenweek's Colors Trap Hint
events.description: Miss Goldenweek is shown with her painting supplies and colored paints, hinting at her unique hypnosis ability called Colors Trap. Though not fully demonstrated yet, her paints are shown to be her primary tool.
events.significance: Sets up Miss Goldenweek's unique non-Devil Fruit ability that will be crucial in upcoming battles.

quotes.speaker: Mr. 3
quotes.context: Showing his refined personality during vacation

quotes.text: I remember now! This island is called Little Garden, and according to the book, no one who has gone there has ever come back!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Warning about Little Garden's dangerous reputation

quotes.text: I bet I can hunt bigger prey than you, moss-head!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Starting the hunting competition with Zoro

quotes.text: Wow! Look at the size of that thing!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Excited reaction to seeing a Brachiosaurus

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the excitement and danger of exploring unknown islands on the Grand Line, particularly one frozen in prehistoric time.
themes.symbolism: Little Garden represents the unpredictable and wondrous nature of the Grand Line, where islands can be frozen in different time periods.
culturalReferences: The prehistoric setting evokes classic adventure stories like 'The Lost World' and 'Journey to the Center of the Earth'

themes.description: The hunting competition between Zoro and Sanji establishes their ongoing rivalry as a source of both tension and motivation.
themes.symbolism: Their competition drives both to become stronger and push their limits, while maintaining camaraderie.

themes.description: The episode contrasts brave explorers (Luffy, Zoro, Sanji) with cautious crew members (Nami, Usopp), showing both approaches have merit.
themes.symbolism: Different personality types within the crew create balance between reckless adventure and practical safety.

characterSpotlights.development: Mr. 3 is introduced as an intelligent, refined Baroque Works agent who values strategy over brute force. His wax powers and arrogant personality are established.
keyActions: Demonstrating Doru Doru no Mi powers
Receiving orders about the Straw Hats

characterSpotlights.development: Miss Goldenweek is introduced as Mr. 3's laid-back partner who takes a casual approach to her missions, even delaying sharing important information.
Zoro's competitive nature with Sanji is formalized as he takes the hunting challenge seriously while showing his practical mindset.
keyActions: Competing with Sanji for largest catch
quotes: I wonder if this thing is edible.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji's rivalry with Zoro takes center stage as he initiates the hunting competition, showing his prideful nature.
quotes: I bet I can hunt bigger prey than you, moss-head!
I'm not going to be dinosaur food!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami serves as the crew's cautious navigator, recalling information about Little Garden's dangers and choosing to stay on the ship.
quotes: I remember now! This island is called Little Garden, and according to the book, no one who has gone there has ever come back!
Me too. Someone has to guard the ship anyway.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime includes extended scenes of Nami barefoot on the ship that were not in the manga.
Additional comedic interactions between Usopp and Nami on the Going Merry are added for pacing.
The wax house scene with Mr. 3 is expanded with more visual detail of his abilities.

trivia.fact: Pandaman makes a cameo appearance in this episode, continuing the series' longest-running Easter egg.
This episode marks the beginning of episodes where Wakana Yamazaki substituted for Akemi Okamura as Nami's voice actress due to Okamura's maternity leave. Yamazaki voiced Nami from episodes 70-78.
Episode 70 is the first episode of the Little Garden Arc, which is considered one of the shorter arcs in One Piece, spanning only 8 episodes (70-77).
The episode adapts portions of manga chapters 115 and 117, notably skipping chapter 116 entirely.
Mr. 3's character design includes hair that changes shape based on his emotions, forming punctuation marks like exclamation points and question marks.
Little Garden is stated to require a full year for the Log Pose to set, the longest recording time shown so far in the series at this point.
The opening theme 'Believe' by Folder5 is actually a Japanese cover of the Eurobeat song 'Dreamin' Of You' by Lolita (Elena Gobbi Frattini).
